page.title: 02BUILDINGS IN RISELEY (l)
page.content: On Thursday afternoon Alex, Vicky, Simon, Peter, Tim, Melanie and I went for a walk with Mrs. Jesson and Mrs. Kennedy and some third years to look at different buildings in Riseley. Some of the different buildings we saw on the way were shops, bungalows, houses, cottages, barns, farms and the church. An old cottage opposite Maple Gardens was being renovated and extended and we discovered that the base of the wall was made of stone but above this it was timber in-filled with wattle and daub. A cottage further along the High Street has one of its rooms used as a craft shop. A telephone exchange is being built to replace the old one in l986. This will be one of the most modern electronic exchanges in the country.
